paper.title: Arbitrary weight changes in dynamic trees

author.org: Algorithms and Complexity, MPI for Informatics, Max Planck Society

paper.abstract: We describe an implementation of dynamic weighted trees, called D-trees. Given a set left{ B_{0},...,B_{n}right} of objects and access frequencies q_{0},q_{1},...,q_{n} one wants to store the objects in a binary tree such that average access is nearly optimal and changes of the access frequencies require only small changes of the tree. In D-trees the changes are always limited to the path of search and hence update time is at most proportional to search time.
